title: Unnatural death of man following social media trial: accused arrested from Vadakara
content: Shimjitha Musthafa had been found absconding after a case was registered against her. Police had issued a lookout circular against her

title: Military power remains the ultimate arbiter of national security, says IAF Chief A.P. Singh
content: He cites the recent experiences of Venezuela and Iraq as cautionary examples of nations left vulnerable without robust defence capabilities

title: SNDP Yogam, NSS move closer as unity plan gets formal nod
content: Vellappally says Yogam vice-president has been tasked with holding follow-up discussions with the NSS. Sukumaran Nair says unity will become a reality

title: The task of searching for truth has become increasingly complex, says writer
content: Nataraj Hulliyar was delivering a special lecture at the UGC Ph.D Course Work (Phase I) Research Seminar at the Mantapa auditorium in Hampi

title: BJP gearing up for ‘Ekatma Manavata Diwas’ in Vijayawada on January 23, 24
content: The Jana Sangh National Conference held in 1965 at the same venue shaped India’s ideological direction based on dharma, say party leaders

title: Promote fisheries in areas with year-round water availability: Mandya DC
content: Fisheries play a role as important as agriculture in boosting farmers’ incomes, says Mandya Deputy Commissioner Kumar

title: Second tranche of industrial incentives released for SC, ST entrepreneurs
content: So far in the current financial year, the government has extended industrial incentives of ₹269 crore to 11,451 entrepreneurs, says MSME Minister Kondapalli Srinivas

title: Lokesh invites Japan’s renewable energy major to invest in green ammonia projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: Industrial hubs such as Visakhapatnam, Kakinada and Krishnapatnam enable integration of renewable energy, LNG infrastructure, low-carbon ammonia facilities, the HRD Minister informs Yukio Kani, Global CEO and Chair of JERA, at the WEF in Davos

title: Railways, events, sports fuel Mizoram tourism
content: State rolls out the Mizoram Tourism Events Calendar 2026 to convert visitors into long-stay travellers

title: YSRCP president Jagan plans padayatra across Andhra Pradesh
content: The former CM accuses the coalition government of resorting to arbitrary governance, misusing the police and filing cases against political opponents

title: Nellore will be developed as a spiritual city, says Minister
content: Anam Ramanarayana Reddy reveals his plans for the development of Venkateswara Swamy temple in Bitragunta, Vengamamba Ammavari temple in Narrawada, and Venugopala Swamy temple in Udayagiri

title: Amaravati Development Corporation conserves  60 tamarind trees during road expansion
content: The corporation’s horticulture experts have undertaken a carefully planned process to translocate the trees, each of which are aged nearly 60, says ADCL Chairperson Lakshmi Parthasarathy

title: Ayushman Bharat will deny 90% people from availing scheme benefits in West Bengal: TMC's Abhishek
content: Had Bengal implemented Ayushman Bharat, only 90 lakh out of its 10 crore people would have qualified to receive the scheme's benefits, leaving the remaining 9.1 crore citizens high and dry, says TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee

title: Situation in violence-hit Kokrajhar under control, say officials
content: Army conducts a flag march in the trouble-torn area for the second consecutive day on Wednesday even as the prohibitory orders under Section 163 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita remain in force in the district

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: WEF 2026: At Davos, Union Minister Vaishnaw says India will definitely become third largest economy
content: Economist Gita Gopinath predicts by 2028 or earlier “depending on how the revision of GDP numbers happens”

title: Sikh Guru remark row: SGPC delegation meets Delhi Police chief, demands FIR against Atishi
content: Citing the transcript, the complaint by the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) said the religious sentiments of the Sikh community worldwide have been seriously hurt by the "highly objectionable utterance" of Ms. Atishi.

title: First State-wide raptor assessment to be held in Tamil Nadu
content: The first day of the survey will include a pre-survey training at the divisional level by the nodal officer and nocturnal assessment. On the second day, the diurnal raptor assessment will take place.

title: Sukhu inaugurates Shimla helicopter services, targets BJP over ₹1,000 crore waste
content: Chief Minister says heliport cleared after sustained efforts; links services to tourism and medical emergencies

title: Dhinakaran’s return to NDA signals thaw in his ties with Edappadi Palaniswami
content: Edappadi Palaniswami said T.T.V. Dhinakaran’s move was aimed at bringing to an end the “brutal reign” of the “evil force DMK” and re-establishing the “golden rule” of Jayalalithaa

title: Kozhikode beach all set for Kerala Literature Festival, which begins on January 22
content: This year’s KLF will feature American astronaut Sunita Williams, Nobel laureate Abdulrazak Gurnah, among others, as speakers

title: Sun’s northward movement and south-easterly winds make afternoons warmer in several parts of Telangana
content: Warm afternoons and mixed winter conditions are likely to continue until around the second week of February, says IMD Hyderabad Centre Scientist Dharma Raju

title: Centre opens consultation on draft National Electricity Policy
content: The draft policy holds that India’s power sector would require about ₹50 lakh crore by 2032 and ₹200 lakh crore by 2047 for expanding generation capacity, transmission and distribution

title: Actor Kamal Roy passes away in Chennai
content: Some of his movies include Sayujyam, Kollilakkam, Manju, Kingini, Kalyanasougandhikam, Vachalam, Shobhanam, among others

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates housing units in Chennai
content: These tenements were built at a cost of ₹147 crore close to the Government Stanley Medical College Hospital

title: Union Cabinet approves ₹5,000 crore equity infusion into SIDBI to enhance credit to MSMEs
content: The equity infusion will be provided by the Department of Financial Services (DFS) and will be divided into three tranches of ₹3,000 crore in 2025-26, and ₹1,000 crore each in 2026-27 and 2027-28

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy questions Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah’s contribution to AHINDA, alleges corrupt officers get protection in Congress rule
content: Referring to the sleaze video clip involving senior IPS officer Ramachandra Rao, the former CM said he had spoken about the same officer as early as 2016

title: Madras Sappers military band to perform at Lalbagh in Bengaluru on January 25
content: This special event seeks to connect citizens with India’s rich military heritage while honouring a song that ignited the freedom movement, and continues to inspire generations

title: Rare sighting of whale shark thrills scuba divers off Visakhapatnam
content: The whale shark sighting occurred as a group of scuba diving instructors, accompanied by two students, were returning from a routine diving session near Chinna Rushikonda

title: Congress convenes national-level dialogue on MGNREGA, workers’ rights
content: The party accused the Narendra Modi government of destroying the entire process where panchayats decided and worked for their prosperity and development

title: Kerala govt revises wage package for ration dealers, hikes basic pay and commission
content: Welcoming the decision, ration dealers’ organisations announce withdrawal of joint agitation scheduled to be held in February

title: Fiscal consolidation, financial discipline major issues in Budget presentation: Yanamala Ramakrishnudu
content: Yanamala observed that the revenue deficit has to be kept under control and, at 9%, Andhra’s revenue is lower than that of several major States

title: Supreme Court extends interim protection to three accused in ₹3,500-crore A.P. liquor scam
content: Court allows accused to seek regular bail while upholding High Court’s decision to cancel default bail, amid allegations of corruption involving high-ranking officials

title: A true crime documentary on violence against women in Telangana
content: ‘Silent Screams: The Lost Girls of Telangana’, which presents three cases from the heartland of the State, will be screened at the Hyderabad Literary Festival 2026

title: Gen Z–inspired social lounge launched at Bengaluru airport
content: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) said that the name of the lounge — Gate Z — emerged from a nationwide contest

title: GOPHA launches forum to strengthen optometry’s role in public health
content: The launch marks GOPHA’s emergence as an international collaborative platform aimed at linking optometry with public health to advance universal eye care

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy favours JD(S) alliance with BJP in local body polls in Karnataka
content: His opinion is in contrast to that of JD(S) national president and former PM H.D. Deve Gowda who had recently stated that the JD(S) would contest the local body polls on its own

title: Noida techie death: what we know so far
content: The uncovered pit, fed by rainwater and drains and lying just off a well-developed road with no barricades and an almost 90-degree turn, had become a serious hazard long before the crash that claimed Yuvraj Mehta’s life.

title: Lamborghini driver booked after video of reckless driving in Bengaluru goes viral
content: The footage shows the sports car zipping through traffic on Mysuru Road in a reckless manner, putting the lives of other road users at risk

title: Kerala Assembly pays tribute to late CPI(M) leader and Koyilandy MLA Kanathil Jameela
content: Reading out obituary reference, Speaker describes Jameela as a leader who consistently took uncompromising, people-centric positions on public issues and was known for her firm interventions in Assembly

title: Andhra Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu seeks action against MLAs skipping Assembly sessions
content: The Speaker was hinting at the continuous absence of 11 MLAs of the YSR Congress Party, including Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy, from the LA and the likely consequences thereof

title: CM Stalin writes to External Affairs Minister for release of T.N. fishermen from Sri Lankan custody
content: In his letter, Mr. Stalin, pointed to the recent apprehension of seven fishermen from Mayiladuthurai district who ventured into the sea for fishing in two boats

title: Additional special trial courts will make judicial system robust: SC
content: The Bench asked the law officer to apprise it by February 10 of the development in setting up of a special court here

title: California-based Blaize to scale up its R&D centre at Hyderabad
content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy meets Blaize co-founder and CEO Dinakar Munagala and discusses about State’s initiatives

title: Kerala man’s death after ‘misconduct’ video: Lookout notice issued against woman accused of abetment
content: Police sources said the 35-year-old Vadakara native has been absconding, prompting the issuance of the lookout circular to prevent her from fleeing the country through any airport

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR updates: Manner of conducting electoral rolls revision must conform to principles of natural justice, says CJI
content: The Election Commission argued that ROPA, 1950, allows it to go beyond the limits of its own rules to revise electoral rolls

title: Sunjay Kapur property case: Rani Kapur moves Delhi High Court to cancel family trust
content: Rani Kapur alleges that her daughter-in-law, Priya Kapur, fraudulently constituted the trust in order to divert assets

title: West Bengal SIR shows ‘logical discrepancies’ that defy scientific possibilities: EC to Supreme Court
content: Two electors were found with more than 200 children, seven with more than a 100 children, 10 with more than 50 children while another 10 with more than 40

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran’s AMMK returns to NDA in Tamil Nadu ahead of Assembly elections
content: “Setting aside our past differences and keeping the welfare of the people of Tamil Nadu in mind, we have wholeheartedly joined the NDA to unseat the DMK from power,” said Mr. Dhinakaran

title: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian apologises for controversial remarks on Malappuram, Kasaragod
content: In a statement, Cherian says he is ‘hurt by the fact that a campaign’ is being carried out by ‘distorting’ his words to make it seem as if these were directed against a particular group

title: Ladki Bahin Yojana: Government to do physical verification of rejected beneficiaries during KYC process
content: The Ladki Bahin scheme was launched in 2024 ahead of Assembly elections, with providing financial aid to women from family having income below 2.5 lakhs

title: Government strengthening rural infrastructure with ₹8,000 crore: Andhra Energy Minister
content: Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar reiterates that village development is the foundation for the State’s growth and assured that development works in the Kanigiri constituency will continue uninterrupted

title: Army deployed in sensitive areas of violence-hit Kokrajhar in Assam
content: A flag march will also be conducted by the Army in the area on Wednesday (January 21, 2026), as part of confidence-building measures, a defence spokesperson said

title: ASHA workers detained en route to Bengal Health Department HQ amid plans to intensify protests
content: The protesting Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHA), who have been on a ‘cease-work’ since December 23, were detained as a precautionary measure, police said

title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Unnikrishnan Potti, however, will continue to be in jail for now as he has also been arrested in the case related to the loss of gold from Dwarapalaka idols of the temple

title: Don’t engage in mudslinging against judges: Madras High Court Chief Justice to ‘Savukku’ Shankar’s counsel
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava says, adverse orders can be taken on appeal instead of abusing court proceedings

title: BJP president Nitin Nabin gets Z security cover from CRPF
content: “A few weeks ago, the Union Home Ministry instructed the CRPF to take charge of his security following his announcement as the new BJP party leader,” officials said

title: Talaq-e-Hasan explained as SC hears validity challenge; how it differs from triple talaq
content: Through Talaq-e-Hasan, a man can dissolve a marriage by pronouncing the word “talaq” once every month over a three-month period.

title: No network zone to connected rainforest: How Agumbe was brought online
content: Local residents played a critical role throughout the process, helping NITK with planning, coordination and cable deployment, and guiding with local knowledge

title: Republic Day 2026: KIA issues passenger advisory for Bengaluru airport
content: In view of the enhanced security measures for Republic Day, passengers have been asked to plan their travel to the airport to allow sufficient time for security checks

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: Sources: McDaniel set to become Chargers OC
content: Former Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel is expected to become the Chargers' offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets continue overhaul, land OF Robert in trade
content: Luis Robert Jr., a former Gold Glover who hit 38 home runs two seasons ago, is headed to the Mets in a trade that sends infielder Luisangel Acuna and right-hander Truman Pauley to the White Sox.

title: Beltran, Andruw Jones elected to Baseball's Hall
content: Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones, center fielders who excelled at the plate and with their gloves, were voted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Mayfield takes swipe at ex-coach Stefanski in post
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield jabbed at new Falcons coach Kevin Stefanski, saying, "Can't wait to see you twice a year, Coach."

title: Harbaugh: Too much focus on Giants' hierarchy
content: New Giants coach John Harbaugh said too much is being made of who has more power to make decisions and that it's important that he and GM Joe Schoen work together.

title: Dubs don't envision Butler trade despite ACL tear
content: Warriors GM Mike Dunleavy told reporters he has no plans to move Jimmy Butler's contract at the trade deadline, despite the veteran forward suffering a season-ending ACL tear.

title: UCLA's Cronin blasts Big Ten over scheduling
content: UCLA's upset of No. 4 Purdue seemed to do little to ease Mick Cronin's wrath over the Big Ten's scheduling, with the Bruins coach saying, "I don't think they care about basketball."

title: Former Bama standout sues NCAA over eligibility
content: Charles Bediako, who entered the 2023 NBA draft and played in the G League, has sued the NCAA to gain reinstatement to join the Crimson Tide.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

content: Darryn Peterson has finally entered the top 10, along with two other players. Cameron Boozer remains No. 1.

content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many players.

content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior's future at Real Madrid: Stay, exit or run contract down?
content: Vinícius Júnior has returned to form for Real Madrid, but what should he do about his future at the club? Here are his options.

title: 'Hire and fire': The exhausting job of a soccer manager in 2026
content: Europe's coaching merry-go-round is in full swing. So, what's it like to be on the receiving end of that pressure?

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: 'Are you happy?': Cignetti's daughter revisits viral 2019 post after father's national title win
content: In 2019, Natalie asked her father if he was happy. He wasn't. Now, his answer to the same question is different.

title: How to bet the American Express: Is it worth betting on Scottie Scheffler to win?
content: The second stop of the PGA Tour brings us short, scorable courses and Scottie Scheffler's first start.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United explore Loftus-Cheek loan
content: Manchester United are exploring their options over a move for AC Milan's Ruben Loftus-Cheek. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Canada PM's speech rocks Davos: Trump in crosshairs; big 'unite' message for India
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney warned the world order is breaking apart, not evolving, during a speech at the World Economic Forum. He urged middle powers like India to unite against great power rivalry and coercion, emphasizing collective resilience over appeasement.

title: K'taka Guv vs Sidda govt: Gehlot refuses to address joint session; what triggered row
content: Karnataka governor Thaawarchand Gehlot has refused to deliver the customary address to the legislature, adding to a recent trend of gubernatorial disputes. This follows similar incidents in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, where governors clashed with state governments over speech content and assembly proceedings. The Karnataka government is set to meet the governor to understand his reasons.

title: Budget 2026 income tax: Will GST-style fewer tax slabs be brought under new income tax regime?
content: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: Will FM Nirmala Sitharaman reduce the number of tax slabs under the new income tax regime to ease compliance and reduce confusion for taxpayers? Times of India Online asks tax experts:

title: Zuckerberg abandons his VR dreams; budget cuts and 1,500 jobs gone
content: Meta executive Dilmer Valecillos assures the public that the tech giant is not abandoning virtual reality, despite recent layoffs and a strategic pivot towards AI-powered wearables. While Reality Labs saw significant cuts and studios shuttered, Valecillos is now focused on VR programs, signaling continued commitment to the technology's future.

title: Caught on cam: Moment when IAF plane 'force landed' in UP
content: An Indian Air Force trainer aircraft crash-landed in Prayagraj after an engine failure mid-air. The aircraft deployed an emergency parachute, allowing for a safe force-landing in an uninhabited area, with both pilots unharmed. This incident follows another aviation emergency earlier this month involving a regional connectivity flight.

title: Bangladesh face T20 WC exit: ICC rejects venue shift request; votes to replace team
content: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's request to shift T20 World Cup matches from India, threatening to replace them if they refuse to travel. This decision follows a dispute over pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL removal and Bangladesh's subsequent ban on IPL broadcasts. Scotland is poised to replace Bangladesh if they maintain their stance.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500bn company faces collapse— read his 600-word note
content: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: Trump's Board of Peace: Is UN the real target? China emerges as unlikely defender
content: China has said it will firmly defend a United Nations–centred global order after receiving an invitation from the United States to join President Donald Trump’s proposed Gaza Board of Peace. While Beijing has not confirmed whether it will accept the offer, it stressed its commitment to the UN system and international law. The invitation has led to debate over whether the new board could emerge as a parallel peace mechanism and what it could mean for existing multilateral institutions and power balances

title: 19 innings, no fifty: Is 'lap shot' behind SKY’s lean patch? Ex-cricketer decodes
content: Former pacer Varun Aaron believes Suryakumar Yadav's recent T20I struggles stem from shot selection and difficulty with slower deliveries. Aaron suggests batting Suryakumar at number four, similar to his IPL role, to improve his consistency and address concerns ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Pata nahi kab khelne ko milega': Samson breaks silence on missed chances - Watch
content: Sanju Samson, India's first-choice keeper for the 2026 T20 World Cup, reflects on his decade-long journey marked by failures and successes.  Having returned to his preferred opening role, Samson emphasizes his fearless approach and the importance of his bond with captain Suryakumar Yadav. He remains driven by a hunger to contribute positively.

title: Tech firms alone may fuel risks: Nadella warns on AI bubble
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed AI bubble fears at the World Economic Forum, emphasizing that widespread benefits beyond tech companies are crucial. He proposed a "complete inversion" of organizational structures, urging leaders to adapt workflows to AI's capabilities to drive productivity and achieve scale, rather than just increasing spending.

title: B'desh crisis: Centres urges kin of officials to leave Dhaka; uptick in anti-India stirs
content: In response to escalating anti-India protests and potential violence in Bangladesh, India has advised families of its diplomats and officials stationed there to return home. This precautionary measure aims to ensure safety, though all Indian missions and posts in Bangladesh remain fully operational. The situation is temporary and will be reassessed.

title: Found a job, heaven knows I’m miserable: Why this Smiths lyric feels ' real' for Gen Z
content: A Smiths lyric from 1984 has become an unlikely anthem for Gen Z’s relationship with work. Drawing on viral online stories and recent research, the article explores why young people feel burned out, disengaged, and dissatisfied both during the job hunt and after getting hired—and how many are questioning whether traditional work can still deliver meaning or fulfilment.

title: 'Drawn to new ideas': Deepinder Goyal resigns as CEO of Zomato parent company Eternal
content: Zomato's parent company Eternal Limited CEO Deepinder Goyal is stepping down from his role, subject to shareholder approval, to pursue high-risk, experimental ideas outside the public company. He will transition to Vice Chairman on the board, with Albinder Dhindsa named as his successor.

title: Klay Thompson’s heartfelt gesture for Megan Thee Stallion leaves fans emotional
content: Klay Thompson and Megan Thee Stallion have inspired billions around the world with the love and commitment they have shown towards each other over the past few months. While Megan Thee Stallion has often spoken out about how grateful she is for Klay Thompson, the star player’s recent gesture has sparked chaos among fans.

title: Civic polls: Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena gets 'helping hand' from MNS in Kalyan-Dombivli
content: In a significant post-poll development, the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has extended support to the Shiv Sena in the Kalyan–Dombivli Municipal Corporation. This alliance, with MNS's five corporators backing the Shiv Sena's 53, brings the total to 58, inching closer to the required majority for forming the civic body's government.

title: Pakistan offers to host Bangladesh's T20 WC matches amid standoff with India
content: Pakistan has offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches, backing Dhaka's refusal to play in India due to security concerns. The ICC is set to decide Bangladesh's participation amid ongoing talks. Bangladesh insists on shifting venues, while the ICC prefers the original schedule. This standoff follows recent IPL-related directives impacting Bangladeshi players.

title: Watch: Outrage over half-naked men waving hookahs in Sonmarg; dancing to ‘Jaata Ka Chhora’
content: A video of bare-chested youths dancing to a Haryanvi song with hookahs in Sonmarg has sparked outrage in Kashmir. Political leaders and civil society condemned the act as provocative and disrespectful to local sentiments and cultural norms, highlighting the insensitivity of the behavior in a peaceful tourist destination.

title: Md Shami, with 462 wickets for India, falls in line for SIR
content: Md Shami, the Indian cricket sensation, took a bold stand for democracy as he attended a voter hearing in Kolkata, wholeheartedly affirming his citizenship. Under scrutiny as an 'unmapped voter' due to his parents' details, Shami brought along his passport to validate his identity and showcased his dedication to the community he represents.

title: Australian Open: When Sachin's childhood idol became first to be disqualified from a Grand Slam
content: At the 1990 Australian Open, tennis icon John McEnroe was disqualified from his fourth-round match, becoming the first player in the Open Era to be defaulted from a Grand Slam for triple court violations. This infamous incident occurred on January 21, marking a significant moment in tennis history.

title: Davos: WEF summit faces two major challenges; why Donald Trump may be the easier one
content: As global leaders convene at Davos, the annual World Economic Forum faces the dual challenge of its elite image and the widening K-shaped economy. While Donald Trump's return garners attention, the deeper concern is the growing divide between the wealthy and those left behind, a structural force threatening global stability.

title: Since 2021, rule by rule: How the Taliban have erased women from public life
content: Since the Taliban's return in August 2021, Afghan women's basic freedoms have been systematically curtailed, transforming them into privileges. Girls are barred from secondary education and universities, most jobs are off-limits, and public spaces are restricted, severely shrinking women's public existence amid economic collapse.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 47: Film shatters 7th week record of 'Stree 2'
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its record-breaking streak, now surpassing 'Stree 2' for the 7th-week box office record. The film's phenomenal run has seen it top charts for multiple weeks, solidifying its status as an All-Time Blockbuster with a worldwide collection exceeding Rs 1285 crore.

title: Gaza future: Netanyahu accepts Trump’s invitation to ‘Board of Peace’
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has agreed to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace," a shift from his earlier criticisms. The board, initially focused on the Gaza ceasefire, has expanded its scope to potentially broker global conflicts. Netanyahu's decision faces domestic opposition from far-right allies.

title: Delhi Metro commuter caught urinating on platform, flees after being recorded
content: A video of a man urinating in a Delhi Metro station sparked outrage online, prompting the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to appeal for passenger cooperation in maintaining cleanliness. Commuters condemned the act as shameful and urged authorities for strict penalties and better enforcement to uphold hygiene standards.

title: Shubman Gill wants Test regulars to play Ranji Trophy; firms up ODI WC plans - exclusive
content: Shubman Gill wants India’s Test regulars to feature in the Ranji Trophy to ensure red-ball readiness ahead of the Sri Lanka tour, which is scheduled in August later this year. At the same time, the management is firming up 2027 ODI World Cup plans, with a focus on middle-overs penetration and building a fast-bowling core.

title: Vinfast VF6, VF7 BNCAP crash test ratings out! Check safety report card
content: VinFast's VF6 and VF7 electric SUVs have achieved a perfect 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. Both models excelled in Adult and Child Occupant Protection, demonstrating strong performance in frontal and side impact scenarios. These results underscore VinFast's commitment to safety as it expands in India.

title: ‘O Romeo’ trailer out: Shahid Kapoor embarks on murderous rampage in Vishal Bhardwaj's action-drama
content: Shahid Kapoor’s ‘O’Romeo’ trailer dropped Wednesday, blending Vishal Bhardwaj’s Mumbai Western with gore. He plays Haseen Ustara, falling for Triptii Dimri’s Afsha amid gang wars. Cast includes Avinash Tiwary, Disha Patani. Fourth Shahid-Vishal collab. Releases Feb 13 vs ‘Tu Yaa Main’.

title: Sanjay Dutt spotted driving Tesla Cybertruck on Mumbai streets
content: In the US, the Tesla Cybertruck is priced from around $80,000, with higher-spec variants commanding a significantly higher premium. The Cybertruck stands out for its bold, sci-fi-inspired styling that breaks away from conventional pickup design. Its silhouette is sharply tapered, almost wedge-like, with flat surfaces, crisp angles, and pronounced creases dominating the exterior. Adding to its distinctive appearance are the minimalist full-width light bars at both ends.

title: Trump vs Khamenei: US president's 'wipe them off' warning to Tehran's 'will cut that hand' threat
content: United States President Donald Trump on Tuesday said America would wipe out Iran if the Islamic nation assassinates him. Trump's remark came hours after Iran warned him not to take any action against the country's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.  Trump had previously said he's given his advisors instructions to obliterate Iran if the country is behind an assassination of him.

title: WPL: RCB players take morning walk on Indian road; video goes viral
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru players Lauren Bell, Nadine de Klerk, and Georgia Voll were spotted enjoying a morning walk in Vadodara ahead of WPL 2026 matches, delighting fans. The outing highlighted player safety concerns after last year’s Australian women cricketers’ harassment in Indore. BCCI condemned the incident, praising prompt police action, while ensuring stricter security protocols for visiting players.

title: US free Europe? EU chief Leyen invokes 1971 ‘Nixon shock’ in Davos; what it means
content: At the World Economic Forum, European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen referenced the 1971 "Nixon shock" to urge Europe to leverage current geopolitical disruptions as a catalyst for change. She highlighted the event's lesson on reducing dependency on foreign currencies, advocating for a new form of European strategic autonomy.

title: 'Count now 70': Congress takes jibe at PM Modi over 'good friend' Trump's Ind-Pak remarks
content: The Congress party has sharply criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi following US President Donald Trump's repeated claims of single-handedly resolving the India-Pakistan conflict last year. Trump asserted he prevented a nuclear escalation, saving millions of lives, a claim India has consistently refuted, stating no third-party mediation was involved.

title: A new low for rupee! Currency falls over 60 paise; reaches 91.74 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a new low of 91.20 against the US dollar on Wednesday, extending its downward trend. This depreciation is attributed to strong dollar demand from metal importers, continued foreign fund outflows, and geopolitical uncertainties. The domestic stock market's sluggish performance also contributed to the rupee's decline.

title: Man fined Rs 150 for running over and killing dog with Mercedes
content: A man who fatally struck a dog with his Mercedes-Benz in 2024 received a Rs 150 fine from a North Goa court. Following a viral video, animal cruelty charges were filed. The accused pleaded guilty, citing it as an involuntary, first-time offense. His lawyer highlighted his age and sole breadwinner status, requesting leniency.

title: Kanpur shocker: Another teen kidnapped, gang-raped by 2 youths
content: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped by two youths in Kanpur's Bilhaur area on Monday night. The victim, who went to an outdoor washroom, was reportedly taken to a nearby house. She returned home hours later and informed her family. A complaint has been filed, and police are actively searching for the accused.

title: Delhi Police arrests youth over viral video of zigzagging through traffic on NH-48
content: Delhi Police apprehended a 21-year-old IGNOU student for allegedly driving an SUV recklessly on NH-48. A viral video prompted swift action, leading to the vehicle's seizure and the driver's arrest. The incident, which occurred on January 18th, endangered commuters, prompting charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Motor Vehicles Act.

title: ‘Your career’s ruined’: Judge warns TISS students linked to Saibaba event
content: In a striking pronouncement, a Mumbai court sounded the alarm for nine TISS students applying for anticipatory bail, warning that their alleged connection to a criminal case could jeopardize their professional paths. The students are being probed for initiating an unauthorized gathering in honor of a professor currently imprisoned over suspected Maoist affiliations.

title: What is the 70 pc and 30 pc rule of RERA and why homebuyers and investors should know it
content: RERA's 70:30 rule mandates developers deposit 70% of buyer funds into an escrow account for construction and land costs, with the remaining 30% for project expenses. This financial discipline protects homebuyers' investments and ensures timely project completion by preventing fund diversion.

title: 'Will hunt you down': TMC's Manirul Islam threatens EC to 'teach a lesson' over SIR
content: Manirul Islam, threatening the Election Commission, is not his first brush with controversy, as the Farakka MLA was accused of leading a mob to the Block Development Office (BDO) in his constituency and ransacking the space, leaving officials injured. After the incident, BJP MLA Gouri Sankar attacked Mamata Banerjee for instigating her party cadres across the state to commit riots and violence.

title: Davos LIVE Updates: Trump's Speech At World Economic Forum Begins
content: Davos LIVE Updates: US President Donald Trump's third visit to Davos as president comes as US allies worry about his ambition to take over Greenland.

title: Trump Lands In Davos Amid Tense Showdown Over Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump descended on Davos on Wednesday for a tense showdown with world leaders, as allies push back on his global order-shaking bid to seize control of Greenland.

title: 'Not Consulted': Election Body Opposes Bengal Action Against Poll Officials
content: The West Bengal government didn't take the Election Commission (EC)'s approval before penalising the erring officers linked to Special Intensive Revision (SIR) duties in a case from last year, the poll body has flagged.

title: "State Splurging On Freebies Important Matter To Examine": Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice Surya Kant on Wednesday observed that the states splurging on freebies is an "important matter to examine" amid concerns that poorly targeted subsidies could create unsustainable fiscal burdens for future generations.

title: Rifaat Al-Assad, 'Butcher Of Hama' And Brother Of Ex Syria President Dies
content: Rifaat al-Assad, the brother of the late Syrian President Hafez al-Assad known by critics as the "butcher of Hama" for crushing an Islamist uprising in the city in 1982 before unsuccessfully challenging for power and going into exile, died on Tuesday

title: Surat's 21-Crore Water Tank Was To Serve 33 Villages. It Collapsed On Day 1
content: In a major crackdown following the catastrophic collapse of a newly built water tank in Surat, the Gujarat Police have registered a criminal case and initiated arrests to address what is being described as a "monumental embarrassment" for the state.

title: Prince Harry In Witness Box To Start Evidence Against Daily Mail Publisher
content: Prince Harry appeared in the witness box at London's High Court to start giving evidence in his privacy lawsuit against the Daily Mail's publisher, the royal's second such appearance in three years.

title: Month After Thackeray Reunion, Team Raj Backs Shinde Sena In Key Civic Body
content: In a surprising move, the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena is reportedly planning an alliance with the newly elected corporators of the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena in the Kalyan Dombivli municipal corporation.

title: Twin Political Storms Grip The Shah Family In Madhya Pradesh
content: The Shah family is at the centre of two explosive controversies in Madhya Pradesh politics--one playing out in the Supreme Court and the other erupting inside the Indian National Congress.

title: Basant Panchami-Friday Coincidence Puts Madhya Pradesh City On High Alert
content: With Basant Panchami on a Friday on January 23 -- only the fourth such coincidence after 2006, 2013 and 2016 -- the administration in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district has stepped up security around the communally sensitive Bhojshala complex.

title: "No Objections": Supreme Court Seeks Action Plan On Proposals To Curb Air Pollution
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Delhi government and other agencies to submit their action plan on the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM)'s long-term recommendations to curb air pollution in the capital city.

title: 5 Landmark Budgets That Strengthened Indian Economy
content: Over the years, some budgets have stood out as turning points, shaping reforms, managing crises, or setting new directions.

title: 'If My Flag Was Orange...': AIMIM Corporator On "Paint Mumbra Green" Remark
content: Clarifying her remark after it sparked a furore, 22-year-old AIMIM Corporator Sahar Yunus Shaikh said she only spoke about turning Mumbra green because that is the colour of her party flag.

title: Union Budget 2026: Inside Manmohan Singhs 1991 Budget That Ushered Economic Reforms
content: It was a make-or-break budget for India. In 1991, the country's finances were in disarray, confidence was shaken, and foreign exchange reserves fell so sharply that they could barely cover a few weeks of imports.

title: Kerala Woman Arrested Over Suicide Of Man She Accused Of Sexual Harassment
content: The 35-year-old woman influencer who accused a 42-year-old man of sexually harassing her on a bus in Kerala, which allegedly led to him dying by suicide, has been arrested.

title: "Don't Let Your Loved Ones Use It": Elon Musk, Sam Altman's Latest Showdown
content: Billionaires Elon Musk and Sam Altman are at loggerheads again after claims linked OpenAI's chatbot, ChatGPT, to multiple deaths.

title: Rupee Falls To Record Low Of 91.74 Against US Dollar
content: The rupee crashed 77 paise to an all-time low of 91.74 against the American currency in intra-day trade on Wednesday, pressured by persistent foreign fund outflow and robust greenback demand from metal importers.

title: Video: A Cow Just Used A Tool. Meet Itch-Scratching Veronika
content: The first known case of tool use in cattle, a behaviour long thought to be beyond the cognitive abilities of cows, has been studied, at least ten years after it was first observed.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Chandrababu Naidu's "Sustainable Growth" Pitch At Davos 2026
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, speaking exclusively with NDTV on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, outlined a vision for inclusive economic growth in his state.
